intro: Pilosocereus superfloccosus, commonly known as the white cactus or the moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stem covered in dense, white, woolly spines. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its unique appearance and nocturnal flowering make it a popular choice for both ornamental and botanical collections.
